column1: But if you 're prepared to hold your horses a little until that final fence, I 've a feeling that you may well end up ahead of the rest of the field [ JH ]

column1: ' Hold your horses, ' said Joe, ' the lady's with me. '

column1: Irritably — she really wanted that cup of tea ; she was growing as bad as the British — McAllister turned off the gas ring, blew out the match, and walked to the front door, grumbling to herself, Hold your horses, I 'm coming, I 'm coming, when another urgent series of knocks sounded.
